notes: This NixOS machine configuration is designed for a storage array server utilizing ZFS. It imports base settings, ZRAM swap, ZFS modules, text editors (Neovim, Emacs), code environment, SSH, audio-visual editing tools, dynamic DNS, hardware configuration, and WireGuard VPN. Nix garbage collection is disabled to preserve caches, VPN uses postfix 4 with Secrix secrets. ZFS services include auto-scrub, trim, and snapshots with specific flags. Boot loader is systemd-boot with EFI support. Networking configures hostname 'storage-array', host ID, default gateway, nameservers, and static IP addresses on multiple interfaces for public and private networks.
reasoning: The configuration optimizes the system for data storage and management, with ZFS providing robust filesystem features like snapshots and scrubbing. Disabling auto-GC prevents loss of cached derivations, crucial for build environments. Networking supports multiple interfaces for segregation of traffic, while VPN ensures secure remote access. Imported environments enable development and media processing on the storage server.
